description: Mayor Koch and his Housing Commissioner said yesterday that 15 months after plans were announced to build 800 subsidized apartments, only 16 apartments have been completed, the project has been scaled back and no decisions have been made about how to spend more than half of the public funds earmarked for the entire plan.

title: Chase Bank Sells Computer Power
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank said it had sold Computer Power Inc., a subsidiary, to a new company owned by Merrill Lynch Capital Partners for $120 million in cash, in addition to securities and warrants in the new company. The sale of Computer Power, which provides computer software and mortgage processing for mortgage companies, is expected to give Chase a third-quarter after-tax gain of $60 million.

title: CENTERIOR ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The 1985 share earnings and shares outstanding are restated to reflect the April 29 merger of Cleveland Electric Illuminating Co. and Toledo Edison Co. to form Centerior.

title: BIAS IS CHARGED
description: Two Puerto Rican teen-agers on vacation here were beaten, one critically, by eight youths in the Belmont section of the Bronx in what the police called an ethnic incident.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Let there be no question about it: I can never commit suicide by accepting threats and prescriptions from outside forces and hand over South Africa to Communist forces in disguise.'' - President P. W. Botha. [ A1:6. ]

title: BDM INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
MENTOR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
NORTH FORK BANCORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Allis to Sell Unit
description: The Allis-Chalmers Corporation has agreed to sell its hydroturbine business at York, Pa., to J.M. Voith G.m.b.H. of Heidenheim, West Germany.

title: A Poll Is a Poll Is a Poll
description: Like many other political technicians, pollsters tend to have an off-season between election campaigns, which may explain why Mervin Field, operator of the California Poll, decided in May to ask people which former President - Richard M. Nixon, Gerald R. Ford or Jimmy Carter - they would favor for a White House foreign affairs assignment if one should arise.

title: Opposition Takes Lead In Jamaican Election
description: The opposition People's National Party captured an early lead today in provincial elections marred by reports of stolen ballots and violence that left two people dead and 20 wounded.

title: FIRST SECURITY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Accounts
description: * Chandris Crusies to Grey Advertising.

title: TELECOM PLUS INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a gain on the sale of assets of $11,475,000 for both the quarter and 6 months. c-Includes a gain from the issuance of stock by subsidiaries of $17,231,000 for both the quarter and the 6 months.

title: STOCKER & YALE INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Results for 1985 include the figures of MFE Instruments Corp. from its acquisition in May 1985.

title: USX EARNINGS FELL 92.2% IN PERIOD
description: The USX Corporation, which is both the nation's largest steelmaker and a big energy concern, said yesterday that its net income plunged 92.2 percent in the second quarter.

title: Cocaine Is Even Deadlier Than We Thought; To Cater to an Addict
description: To the Editor:

title: FILM: 'ASSAM GARDEN,' WITH DEBORAH KERR
description: ''THE ASSAM GARDEN,'' a British movie that opens today at the Film Forum, brings Deborah Kerr back to America's screens after 15 years. She plays an elderly woman in the southwest of England whose husband has just died. As young marrieds, the couple had run a tea plantation in India, and on their return home, they created an elaborate, Indian-style garden in their big backyard. Miss Kerr is convinced that her husband gave his life to it.

title: AFTER DEEP DIVISIONS, JURORS REACHED COMPROMISE
description: The battle was as fiercely fought as any football championship, and the six jurors who spent 31 grueling hours deliberating the fate of the United States Football League's antitrust suit against the National Football League showed both courage and perseverance in the face of confusion and personal suffering.

title: MANAGEMENT SCIENCE AMERCA INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
BUSINESS DIGEST: WEDNESDAY, JULY 30, 1986
description: The Economy Paul A. Volcker warned that the large trade deficit had put the economy in ''difficult and dangerous'' circumstances, crippling industry and causing an unsustainable dependence on inflows of foreign money. But the Fed chairman told the House Banking Committee that he did not foresee a recession. Asserting that inflation is likely to remain low, he also indicated that interest rates could move lower. [ Page D1. ] Prices of Treasury securities recovered as traders interpreted Mr. Volcker's testimony as a sign that further rate cuts are possible. [ D14. ] The tax revision deadlock was apparently broken by several Senate concessions. Lawmakers said that the Senator conferees had agreed to raise some business taxes, especially for banks, and to allow more generous deductions for certain individuals. Representative Rostenkowski, head of the House delegation, said he would make a counteroffer today that would modify the Senate proposal only slightly. [ D1. ] Millions of public employees in at least 14 states may have to pay Federal income tax on employer pension contributions if a Senate tax provision becomes law. [ D6. ] Companies USX's net income plunged 92.2 percent, to just $14 million, in the second quarter. USX, the former U.S. Steel, attributed the results to the deterioration in oil and natural gas prices and to losses in its steel operations. The company's contract with the United Steelworkers expires at midnight Thursday, and David M. Roderick, USX's chairman, warned the union that a strike would severely hurt the company's steel operations.

title: THE SCREEN: 'FLIGHT OF THE NAVIGATOR'
description: THE story of a boy and his nonhuman pal, flying through space trying to get the boy back home, sounds like an easy reversal of ''E.T.'' But ''Flight of the Navigator,'' the latest Disney film, blends fantasy and reality into such a lively and touching adventure that it's far more accurate to consider it a lucky heir to Steven Spielberg's influence. This is a film with its head in the clouds, its feet on the ground and - just often enough - its heart on its sleeve, in which space-age special effects take second place to family emotions.

title: MEXICAN OPPOSITION BREAKS ITS BLOCKADE OF BRIDGE AT EL PASO
description: Mexico's opposition party today peacefully ended its six-day blockade of an important bridge across the Rio Grande between here and Ciudad Juarez, Mexico.

title: OREGON METALLURGICAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
STAGE: 'A MAN'S A MAN,' STARRING BILL MURRAY
description: There are at least two sides to Bill Murray's talent. He is a comedian and comic actor (in films from ''Meatballs'' to ''Tootsie'') and, increasingly, he has demonstrated his desire to become a dramatic actor (as in the remake of ''The Razor's Edge''). At the Hyde Park Festival Theater, he is attempting to mesh both aspects by playing the central role in ''A Man's a Man'' by Brecht.

title: VULCAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes extraordinary credits of $918,406 and $928,887 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-Includes extraordinary credits of $5,267 and $333,938 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: Aid for Citizenship
description: Hispanic immigrants living legally in the United States may view the Immigration and Naturalization Service as more likely to send them back to their original countries than to help them fill out citizenship papers, according to Dr. Harry Pachon, executive director of the National Association of Latino Elected and Appointed Officials.

title: Killing Threat Described In Florida Murder Trial
description: Scott Benson threatened to kill his mother in a quarrel over his dog and she sent him to a psychiatric ward, a witness said today in the murder trial of Scott's uncle, Steven Wayne Benson.

title: Dow Falls 7.03, to Two-Month Low
description: Concerns about interest rates and the economy lingered on Wall Street yesterday, causing a moderate drop in stock prices that resulted in blue-chip issues closing at their lowest levels in more than two months.

title: WANTED: A TOUGH TEAM TO TAKE ON TAX CHEATS
description: The City Finance Department is beginning a war on the ''underground economy'' in New York and is seeking a few skilled men and women to join the cause.

title: GOODY PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding are restated to reflect a 50- percent stock dividend paid July 1, 1986. The company said the sales and earnings in the latest quarter include results of its Opti-Ray subsidiary for the entire quarter. Opti-Ray was acquired by Goody on May 8, 1985 and the prior quarter reflects the results of Opti-Ray only from that date forward.

title: STYLISH SNACK: JAPANESE TOAST THE BAGEL
description: OFTEN, first-time customers do not approach the counter so much as circle it, their faces scrunched in a tentative, what-is-this look. ''How garlicky is the garlic?'' they ask. ''What does the onion taste like? Is the poppy seed better than the plain?'' From behind her counter in the Seibu department store just off the Ginza, Junko Sassamoto fields questions with the assurance of someone telling newcomers for perhaps the thousandth time that the round items with the big holes in the middle are not what they suspect. ''Some of them think it's a doughnut,'' she said. ''I have to tell them it's bread.''

title: WILENTZ REAPPOINTMENT CLEARED BY JERSEY PANEL
description: The State Senate Judiciary Committee today released the nomination of Robert N. Wilentz to continue as Chief Justice of the State Supreme Court. The action was taken after two days of hearings that were dominated by a debate over whether Mr. Wilentz lived in New Jersey or New York.

title: CORRECTION
description: Two pictures on the Washington Talk page yesterday with an article on employee benefits appeared with the captions reversed. Marsha Levick was on the left; Virginia B. Lamp was on the right.

title: LONE STAR TECHNOLOGIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After interest income of $400,000 for the quarter and $200,000 for the 6 months and tax credits of $2.4 million for the quarter and $4.9 million for the 6 months. c-After a $300,000 interest expense and a $9 million tax credit. d-After interest income of $200,000, a $100,000 charge and a $19 million tax benefit.

title: JORDAN FACES FIGHT TO REMAIN A GIANT
description: David Jordan can count. He knows that the Giants will probably keep eight offensive linemen this year, and he knows that six of those eight are almost sure to be Bart Oates at center, Billy Ard and Chris Godfrey at guard, and Karl Nelson, Brad Benson and William Roberts at tackle.

title: Man Who Threatened Reagan Arraigned in Fatal Stabbing
description: A 38-year-old drifter who was released from prison earlier this month after serving a sentence for threatening the life of President Reagan was arraigned in Manhattan on a murder charge yesterday in the stabbing death of a 78-year-old retired school teacher.

title: A Tax Credit Worth Saving
description: The Congressional conference committee on tax reform is the most ballyhooed in modern memory - and no wonder. It will implement the most sweeping change in the tax code in American history. But amid all the drama, centered on such explosive issues as individual retirement accounts, the treatment of capital gains and sales tax deductions, a number of issues tiny by comparison but crucial for public policy are in danger of getting overwhelmed in the process.

title: 'SUMMERFARE' OFFERS CHOIR FESTIVAL
description: THE sound of a gigantic chorus, singing out joyfully, is an inspiring one; Stephen Sondheim's lyric about ''proof of heaven while you're living'' comes to mind. Although that analogy was first used in a very different context, it would probably not displease the participants in the Ocean Grove Choir Festival, held annually in Ocean Grove, N.J. ''Summerfare,'' tonight at 9 on Channel 13, will present an hourlong exaltation of the festival, recorded in July 1985. Some 1,200 singers and 8 choral conductors, all under the general music direction of Lewis Daniels, took part, and the result is a joyful noise indeed.

title: GLOBAL MARINE INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company said the latest quarter and 6 months losses are after a charge of $75 million related to the release of a rig to certain creditors and a writedown of $17 million on the value of oil and gas properties.

title: AFFILIATED BANK CORPORATION OF WYOMING reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: TEXAS PACIFIC LAND TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Offer for Safeway May Be Delayed
description: A $69-a-share, $4.25 billion tender offer for Safeway Stores Inc. may not begin officially until Friday, sources close to Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts & Company said. Kohlberg agreed to buy the food chain Sunday to foil a hostile takeover bid by the Dart Group Corporation.

title: ODD MIX OF GAMES AND ANTITRUST LAW
description: The finding yesterday that the National Football League was guilty of monopolistic behavior, but that the United States Football League had suffered only nominal damages, intrigued antitrust lawyers.

title: VOLCKER SEES NO RECESSION
description: Paul A. Volcker, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, said today that the trade deficit had put the economy in ''difficult and dangerous'' circumstances but that he did not think the economy was headed for a recession.

title: KERR GLASS MANUFACTURING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
UNITED BRANDS CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a pretax gain of about $15 million from the termination of a defined benefit retirement plan which was replaced with a defined contribution plan. c-Includes an extraordinary gain of $2,071,000 on the retirement of debt.

title: 'MASTER HANDYMAN' BARELY COPES UNDER PINOCHET
description: When opponents of Gen. Augusto Pinochet called a general strike early in July, Jorge Cueto Nunez did not work. Half of the reason, he said, was political conviction. The other half was fear.

title: 16 FREIGHT CARS FALL INTO VALLEY IN IOWA, SPILLING CHEMICALS
description: Sixteen cars of a freight train blew off a bridge in a fierce storm Monday and plunged 185 feet into the Des Moines River Valley, spilling chemicals from truck trailers that were on board. State officials today were seeking to learn what chemicals were involved.

title: KEMPER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After capital gains of $11,415,000 for the quarter and $20,777,000 for the 6 months. c-After capital gains of $1,354,000 for the quarter and $5,864,000 for the 6 months. The per share earnings have been restated to reflect a 3-for-1 stock split in June 1986.

title: PUBLIC EMPLOYEES CITY PENSION THREAT IN TAX BILL
description: Millions of public employees in at least 14 states, including more than a million civil servants in New York, may have to begin paying Federal income taxes on employer contributions to their pension plans if a provision in the Senate tax bill becomes law.

title: FRANCE NOW CLOSES THE BOOK ON AFFAIR OVER GREENPEACE
description: The dispute over the sinking of an environmentalist group's ship in Auckland harbor in New Zealand, an incident that shook France for months, is finally over.

title: Wings Get Hanlon
description: Glen Hanlon, a Ranger goalie for the last four seasons, has been shipped to the Detroit Red Wings along with the Rangers' third-round picks in the 1987 and 1988 drafts for three players: Kelly Kisio, a center; Lane Lambert, a right wing, and Jim Leavins, a defenseman. The deal was the latest in a series of moves by Phil Esposito, the Rangers' new vice president and general manager.

title: A Less-Ambitious Alternative to a New SALT Pact
description: The tempo of United States-Soviet relations is once more picking up, and with it optimism about a second Reagan-Gorbachev summit meeting and arms control. Yet for political and technical reasons, a full-fledged arms control accord is likely to prove beyond the Administration's reach. As a result, America would do better to lower its sights and seek a framework pact, one that established key ceilings and broad principles, rather than attempt to negotiate and gain approval for a successor to the SALT accords.

title: AMERICAN FILTRONA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
PROFITS SCOREBOARD
description: See accompanying notes for special items.(Loss) * Loss in year-earlier period.

title: APPLIED DATA COMMUNICAIONS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: NEWS SUMMARY: WEDNESDAY, JULY 30, 1986
description: International

title: SMD INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 28
AMAX INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a gain of $80 million in the first quarter from adopting an FASB principle applicable to the 1984 recovery of excess assets in the company's pension plan for salaried employees. c-Net loss and includes a $315 million provision for losses on continuing business segments for both the quarter and 6 months.

title: CHEVRON NET DROPS BY 37.8%
description: The Chevron Corporation, the nation's fourth-largest oil company, yesterday reported quarterly profits 37.8 percent below those of a year ago. The Sun Company, the 11th-largest oil concern, said its second-quarter profits shrunk by 31.5 percent from the comparable 1985 period.

title: HUNT FOR TIGER, OR SOMETHING, STIRS PENNSYLVANIA
description: There may or may not be a Bengal tiger loose around this part of northeastern Pennsylvania. But after watching local riflemen trying to hunt down whatever has been stirring alarms hereabouts, George Lowry is sure of one thing.

title: Insider Case Indictment
description: Costandi Nasser, a Middle Eastern businessman who lives in Europe, was indicted yesterday on charges that he illegally used inside information to earn more than $4.6 million by trading in the securities of Santa Fe International before a takeover was begun. Santa Fe International, a large oil and gas company, was taken over by an arm of the Kuwaiti Government in 1981 for $2.5 billion. The Securities and Exchange Commission earlier filed civil charges against more than a dozen individuals in the case.

title: THE SCREEN: DORIS DORRIE'S 'MEN'
description: IT'S easy to understand why ''Men'' has been filling theaters in West Germany for the last eight months. This deftly turned anecdote is the best feminist joke yet to reach the screen, and, although comparisons to Ernst Lubitsch may be premature, its 31-year-old West German director and writer, Doris Dorrie, who studied movie making in America, has a witty and winning way with a line and a camera.

title: KOREANS BREATHE NEW LIFE INTO QUEENS CHURCH
description: First United Methodist Church of Flushing is really two congregations, one of Americans with deep roots in this country and the other of Korean immigrants.

title: Will Nunn Run? The Door Is Open
description: Senator Sam Nunn of Georgia and former Gov. Charles S. Robb of Virginia have a mutual admiration society going, with each trying to persuade the other to seek the Democratic nomination for President.

title: ORANGE & ROCKLAND UTILITIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
VALLEN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to May 31
NU-MED INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
description: b-Net income

title: Cocaine Is Even Deadlier Than We Thought; To Cater to an Addict
description: To the Editor:

title: TACO VILLA INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: Virginia Star Pleads
description: Barry Word, the former Virginia football star and third-round draft choice of the New Orleans Saints, entered a plea of guilty to conspiring to distribute cocaine.

title: DETROIT EDISON CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
11 REPUTED BAMBOO GANG MEMBERS GO ON TRIAL
description: A Federal prosecutor told the jury in a racketeering trial yesterday that an international gang, the United Bamboo, murdered a Chinese-American journalist in California ''in response to the suggestion of officials in Taiwan.''

title: VF Chief Is Reshaping Domestic Jeans Market
description: Lawrence R. Pugh, the chairman and chief executive of the VF Corporation, acknowledges that the jeans business has matured. But he said he expected to squeeze a profit out of it by realigning the market.

title: Earn! In Your Own Home!
description: Work at home: union leaders charge that it's a step back toward the cruel exploitation of labor, evoking Dickensian scenes of sweatshops and child labor.

title: 'MORNING NEWS' PRODUCER TO LEAVE
description: Susan Winston, the executive producer of the ''CBS Morning News'' who was hired three months ago to revamp the program, is leaving the network on Friday, CBS said yesterday.

title: LIZ CLAIBORNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The latest 6 months' results include the operations of Liz Claiborne accessories.

title: UNGARO INVOKES BALENCIAGA'S ELEGANCE
description: Emanuel Ungaro dedicated his fall and winter couture collection to ''Monsieur Cristobal Balenciaga,'' for whom he once worked as a tailor. This caused a sinking feeling among some viewers at this morning's opening. They feared they would see a rerun of boring 1950's looks. That was not what happened, however. Balenciaga was invoked to recall the spirit of the golden years of the couture when the style was elegant and expertise prevailed. Ungaro accomplished this in his own way, with clothes of amazing intricacy, beautifully executed.

title: USX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a $59 million pension credit to operating income, a $31 million gain from the sale of assets and the favorable impact of $11 million in LIFO inventory reductions for the latest quarter net,which had no share earnings after preferred dividends; and the 6-month net loss is after a gain of $8 million from the early retirement of debt. c-Includes a $9 million gain on the disposal of assets and a $19 million favorable impact from LIFO inventory reductions. d-Net income and includes a $38 million gain from the retirement of debt and a $45 million gain from the adoption of a change in accounting for petroleum revenue tax payable to the United Kingdom.

title: CENTOCOR INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes tax credit of $535,418 and $984,127 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-Includes tax credits of $390,951 for the quarter and $631,514 for the 6 months.

title: FARM STANDS: GROWTH INDUSTRY PUTS PRODUCE AT HAND
description: THE atmosphere remains one of bucolic charm, with rustic spaces festooned with wagon wheels and bunches of drying herbs, but today the talk around roadside farm stands is of crop diversification, experimental hybrids, direct marketing techniques and urban greenmarkets.

title: Transco and Global Losses
description: The Transco Energy Company and Global Marine Inc., two energy-related concerns based in Houston, today announced second-quarter losses, citing write-downs in asset values and other special charges.

title: MOROCCAN JEWS TALK OF THE KING'S FATE, AND THEIRS
description: Like other Moroccans, Miriam and her family gathered around their television set the other night to watch King Hassan II explain why he had invited Prime Minister Shimon Peres of Israel to visit.

title: U.S.-SOVIET DIPLOMACY: HOPE BUT STILL AMBIGUITY
description: President Reagan's aides say he is now giving a public face to his secret diplomacy with the Soviet Union. It is a face his aides acknowledge reflects hope for arms control agreements and continued ambiguity, if not ambivalence, on how to achieve them.

title: ZIMMER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 12
Fear and Shoe Leather Among the Lobbyists
description: ''We're just trying to keep a little control,'' the Capitol police officer said, loudly and firmly, sounding much like a high school principal three days into a class trip. ''We're asking you to stay in this area.''

title: KAPLAN INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss

title: REHNQUIST SAYS HE DIDN'T DETER VOTERS IN 60'S
description: Associate Justice William H. Rehnquist today specifically denied allegations by more than 10 people who have said they saw him questioning or challenging voters about their qualifications at polling places in Phoenix in the early 1960's.

title: INTERSTATE SECURITIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ALTRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: Making a Fuel From Old Tires
description: WHAT do you do with an old tire? Tire makers and recyclers are being pressed to answer that question, with more than 240 million scrap tires generated in this country each year.

title: Article 818986 -- No Title
description: The House today approved a bill appropriating $10 billion for Federal transportation programs, with sponsors fighting off efforts to force the rehiring of 1,000 air traffic controllers dismissed in a 1981 strike.

title: BIG STEEL IS GETTING SMALLER
description: America's eight largest steel producers in the last four years have collectively lost $8 billion, a staggering sum. Two have filed for bankruptcy, and the industry's bloodletting continues unstanched.

title: TECH-OPS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 28
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $18,000 and $2,335,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Includes income from discontinued operations of $2,636,000 and $3,335,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. Share earnings for 1985 are restated to reflect discontinued operations.

title: TIMEPLEX INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a $1,135,000 non-recurring tax benefit related to previously undistributed earnings of its Domestic International Sales Corp.

title: Smudged Oilers
description: This has not been a glorious offseason for the Edmonton Oilers. But through the disappointment of failing to hold on to the Stanley Cup and after suffering through charges that some team members were drug users, the accolades for Wayne Gretzky roar on.

title: LOMAS & NETTLETON MORTATE INVESTORS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ROCK CONCERT: VAN HALEN
description: THE new Van Halen, with Sammy Hagar replacing David Lee Roth as lead singer, has a split personality. One part is the rude, fast, raucous heavy-metal band that Van Halen used to be, swigging whisky onstage and blasting out songs about running wild. The other part delivers what rock radio stations call ''anthems'' -vague, goody-goody material about, as Mr. Hagar said straight-faced, ''hopes, wishes and dreams.'' One such song, ''Why Can't This Be Love,'' recently propelled the band's album ''5150'' to No. 1.

title: Treasury Sets $28 Billion Sale
description: The Treasury Department announced yesterday that it will auction a record $28 billion of 3-year, 10-year and 30-year securities Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday next week at its quarterly refunding, an amount slightly smaller than the credit markets had expected.

title: OLD REPUBLIC INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After realized investment gains of $7,729,382 for the quarter and $13,305,523 for the 6 months. c-After realized investment gains of $4,390,671 for the quarter and $5,102,987 for the 6 months.

title: LINCOLN TELECOMMUNICAIONS CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
FATHER JENCO GIVES MESSAGE TO POPE FROM SHIITES
description: The Rev. Lawrence Martin Jenco kept a promise today to the militant Shiites who held him captive in Lebanon for nearly 19 months and delivered a message from them to Pope John Paul II.

title: SHULTZ WARNS ON PROTECTIONIST BILLS
description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz said today that ''there is reason to be unsettled and alarmed'' over the protectionist legislation that has been sweeping through Congress.

title: U.S.F.L. TO REVIEW FINDINGS MONDAY
description: Harvey Myerson, the attorney for the United States Football League, said yesterday that a Federal jury's award of $1 in damages in the U.S.F.L.'s antitrust case against the National Football League ''defies logic'' because the jury found that the N.F.L. violated antitrust law.

title: AMWEST INSURANCE GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes realized investment gains of $5,031 for the quarter and $57,866 for the 6 months. c-Includes realized investment gains of $46,717 and $44,917 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: WEYENBERG SHOE MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
AMERICANS AND SANDINISTAS, AT U.N., CLASH OVER REBELS
description: Delegates from the United States and Nicaragua squared off against each other in the Security Council today as diplomats worked on the text of a resolution involving the two countries. The resolution calls for compliance with a recent World Court decision outlawing American financial backing of anti-Government guerrillas in Nicaragua.

title: ARGENTINA AND BRAZIL SIGN PACTS
description: The Presidents of Brazil and Argentina said today that they had signed agreements to create the ''political framework'' for the long-sought economic integration of their two countries.

title: SAFEGUARD SCIENTIFICS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes an extraordinary credit of $1,378,000 from the termination of a pension plan.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: MOM'S POP ART In one dictionary the phrase Renaissance man is explained as ''a highly cultivated man who is skilled and well-versed in many or, ideally, all of the arts and sciences.'' Rosalyn Drexler is a painter, novelist, playwright (three Obies and one Emmy to her credit), critic, lyricist, wife, mother and, as ''Rosa Carla, the Mexican Spitfire,'' wrestler. She is perhaps a Renaissance woman.

title: Strong Growth In Help Field
description: EARNINGS growth for companies in the temporary-help business is anything but temporary, as indicated by the most recent quarterly reports - the latest in a string of steady gains.

title: BID TO KEEP SALES TAX DEDUCTION
description: House conferees on the tax revision bill decided today to insist at the outset of negotiations with the Senate that the final legislation permit people to deduct their state and local sales tax payments.

title: Bump, Unbump, Rebump
description: Vice President Bush's trip to the Middle East, planned in part to help position the Republican Presidential front-runner as a seasoned hand on the diplomatic front, is drawing some attention of just the sort his staff worked hard to avoid.

title: 5 MODELS INTRODUCED BY TANDY
description: The Tandy Corporation, the nation's largest retailer of consumer electronic products, introduced five I.B.M.-compatible personal computers yesterday that seem likely to step up the already rapid price-cutting throughout the personal computer industry.

title: SIERRACIN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $64,000 and $289,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and for both periods a loss on disposal of discontinued operations of $307,000. c-Net loss and includes losses from discontinued operations of $67,000 and $120,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: ACCESSORIES FROM ALL OVER
description: FOR more than 16 years, Ilene Chazanof has scoured the world and collected small accessories and some furniture for the home, along with jewelry, that date from as far back as the 1890's. Her inventory includes Scandinavian glass from Orrefors, Kosta-Boda and Iitala ($12 for a very small vase to $200 for a large one), American art pottery such as Rookwood ($30 to $85) and Art Deco chrome or Bakelite picture frames ($35 to $75).

title: Women Blocked On Sanitation Jobs
description: The city's plan to hire its first female sanitation workers next week was thwarted yesterday when an appellate judge ruled that a disputed Civil Service test could not be used to select a new class of trainees.

title: GENERAL RE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes realized investment gains of $6,600,000 for the quarter and $13,400,000 for the 6 months. c-Includes realized investment gains of $1,900,000 and $2,200,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and losses from discontinued operations of $29,500,000 for the quarter and $28,500,000 for the 6 months. Share earnings and shares outstanding reflect a 2-for-1 stock split in June.

title: Against Australia's Grain
description: The farm web grows more tangled. Desperate to unload America's surplus grain, the Senate last week passed a bill requiring President Reagan to subsidize wheat exports to China and the Soviet Union. Australia, a wheat grower that does not subsidize sales, is furious. Canberra threatens unspecified retaliation.

title: POOL PARAPHERNALIA GAINS POPULARITY
description: IN the beginning, pool toys were simple - a beach ball, a raft, a pair of flippers. But today, adornments for the pool seem to outnumber those for the home.

title: SHEEP RANCHING: NEW OPPORTUNITY IN MARKET REVIVAL
description: Like most big Western sheep producers, Steve Raftopoulos owes a lot on his land, rarely gets weekends off, knows that his business is in the grip of forces beyond his control - and is a happy man.

title: THREE NEW YANKS MAKE QUICK DEBUT
description: Late Tuesday night, Ron Hassey, standing in front of his locker, fidgeted with a cigarette and played the part of the ballplayer sent packing. ''I don't want to go,'' he said. ''I did everything they asked of me. I don't want to go.''

title: BARON DATA SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Don't We Care?
description: If Americans were asked whether a political cause could justify the deliberate maiming and killing of innocent civilians, most would surely reject the idea. Those are the tactics of terrorism, we would say; that is the indiscriminate brutality of Soviet repression in Afghanistan.

title: Bump in a Flat Tax
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S., IN SHIFT, MAY OPPOSE LOANS TO CHILE, STATE DEPT. OFFICIAL SAYS
description: A top State Department official said today that the Reagan Administration was likely to vote against new international loans to Chile unless it improved its human rights record significantly.

title: DRIVE TO ARREST STREET PEDDLERS IS RULED BIASED
description: A Manhattan judge has charged that the Police Department selectively enforced the city's laws on street peddling against Senegalese nationals ''based on an impermissible standard of race and nationality that the Constitution forbids.''

title: Yields Are Lower
description: Yields on certificates of deposit, bank money market accounts and money market mutual funds were all lower for the week ended yesterday.

title: National Lampoon Going Bimonthly in '87
description: National Lampoon magazine is going to cut its publishing frequency next year to six issues a year, it said, because it is having difficulty supplying new high-grade humor after more than 16 years as a monthly.

title: JAZZ: 6 PIANISTS AT 92nd STREET Y
description: The anomaly of too much resulting in too little undercut the promise inherent in the program ''Stride Piano and Other Delights,'' Tuesday evening's concert in the 92d Street Y's Jazz in July festival.

title: ATLANTIC FINANCIAL FEDERAL reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $2,400,000 for both the quarter and 9 months. c-Includes a gain of $2,680,000 from a dividend paid by the Federal Home Bank Board in the form of Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. stock. Corrected from yesterday's editions.

title: Hughes Tool to Acquire Drilling Unit
description: The Hughes Tool Company, one of the world's largest oil well drilling services companies, said today it had reached an agreement to acquire the drilling services unit of Combustion Engineering Inc.

title: Long, Gregg Suspended
description: Terry Long and David Gregg, the two Maryland basketball players charged Friday with cocaine possession and obstruction of justice in the death June 19 of Len Bias, have been suspended from the team indefinitely.

title: Judges Seek Symbol of Injustice
description: The keepers of a temple of justice, the Appellate Division Courthouse on Madison Square, wish to add a message to its sculptural allegories: that indifference to injustice is the greatest evil.

title: Manley Party Wins In Jamaican Election
description: The opposition People's National Party of former Prime Minister Michael N. Manley decisively defeated the ruling Jamaica Labor Party in local elections, officials said today.

title: Arms and Umbrage
description: Members of Congress often encounter stormy weather, so a group called Physicians for Social Responsibility will give all of them just what they need today: an umbrella. The catch is, the umbrellas are full of holes.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Sports Pages yesterday about the jury deliberations in the United States Football League's antitrust suit against the National Football League misidentified a juror. She was Bernez R. Stephens.

title: UNIVERSITY GENETICS reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
UNC INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $1,081,000, an extraordinary charge of $1,112,000 and a tax credit of $2,217,000 for the quarter, and for the 6 months, includes income from discontinued operations of $1,081,000, an extraordinary charge of $1,112,000 for early retirement of debt and a tax credit of $4,397,000. c-Includes income from discontinued operations of $110,000 and a tax credit of $1,715,000. d-After a gain of $1,186,000 from the sale of a building, but is before income from discontinued operations of $153,000 and a tax credit of $4,400,000.

title: KENNER PARKER TOYS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After tax credits of $2,281,000 for the quarter and $2,368,000 for the 6 months. c-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $4,823,000 for the quarter and $17,162,000 for the 6 months.

title: A Fish Fight
description: Two anglers aboard a boat on Chesapeake Bay were delighted last weekend when their rods suddenly bent double and they found themselves simultaneously reeling in a hefty 12-pound trout.

title: ALLIANCE FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
KENNY HILL PAYS NO HEED TO CRITICS
description: A man with a bachelor of science degree in molecular biophysics from Yale normally gets a certain amount of respect, and Kenny Hill is respected for that. A man who starts at strong safety for a successful team in the National Football League also seems a candidate for respect, but Kenny Hill sometimes has problems there.

title: MONEY WOES EASE FOR BALLET THEATER
description: The year that is just ending has been a good one for American Ballet Theater, though it entered the 1985-86 season with substantial financial troubles. It had a $2 million deficit, its revenue projections had been overly optimistic and the company had suffered enormous losses in two of the cities on its national tour.

title: TEXACO BATTLE MOVES TO APPEALS COURT TODAY
description: Texaco Inc., which lambasted the Texas trial courts for ''fundamental unfairness'' after being hit with an $11 billion judgment last year in its battle with the Pennzoil Company, goes before the Texas judiciary today to plead for a reversal of that verdict or a new trial.

title: ADVANCED MAGNETICS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Shekel's Link To Dollar Ends
description: Israel said today that it would link its shekel, currently aligned to the dollar, to a basket of currencies as of Friday.

title: A Lilco Takeover Plan Is Blocked Temporarily
description: A State Supreme Court justice today temporarily blocked a Suffolk County law that provides for a public takeover of the Long Island Lighting Company.

title: NEW RESTAURANT: FANTASY WORLD ON THE POTOMAC
description: One view of this city holds that it never has been very connected to the real world, and by that way of thinking the sprawling new riverfront restaurant created by Warner LeRoy will be right at home here. For Potomac, as the new restaurant is called, is perhaps the most magical of Mr. LeRoy's creations, a vast two-story dining room that is designed, consciously and deliberately, as a kind of fantasy land for grown-ups.

title: Guerrero Activated
description: Pedro Guerrero, who has been out all season recuperating from knee surgery, was reactivated by the Los Angeles Dodgers last night. The outfielder filled the spot on the roster vacated by Ken Landreaux, who was placed on the disabled list Monday.

title: Ella Fitzgerald Leaves Niagara Falls Hospital
description: Ella Fitzgerald was released from Niagara Falls Medical Center today after recovering from congestive heart failure.

title: WEATHER FORECASTERS PREDICT LITTLE RELIEF FOR SOUTHEAST
description: The mercury hovered near 100 degress again today in the Southeast, and the National Weather Service said its long-range forecasts indicated no break in the pattern of hot, dry weather that has resulted in the region's worst drought in a century.

title: LIGHTING FOR PICTURES
description: WHEN selecting a picture light, the rule of thumb is to buy one approximately one-half the width of the painting. However, this varies widely, depending on one's taste and the desired effect.

title: US HOME CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After an after-tax charge of $80 million related to its restructuring and cost-cutting programs for both the quarter and 6 months, and for the 6 months, is before a loss from discontinued operations of $19,362,000. c-Net income d-Includes a loss from discontinued operations of $1,852,000.

title: CONTINENTAL AIRLINES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a charge of $58.2 million from Chapter 11 reorganization and reorganization-related professional fees of $6 million for the quarter, and a total of $70.2 million reorganization- related charges for the 6 months. c-Net income d-After tax credits of $16,268,000 and $23,322,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and the quarter also includes reorganization-related charges of $6.7 million.

title: HERS
description: I NEED some rocks of certainty to cling to in the rushing water of this uncertain world, and I thought for a while that I had one. I was sure I was not supposed to put bananas in the refrigerator - oh no, no-no, no-no-no! I was sure of this because a prohibition has been sung at me for years in an advertising jingle. Any piece of advertising I personally have had to do with has been relentlessly raked over by experts before being loosed on the public, so I took the sentiments sung at me for gospel - or, to put it in contemporary terms, for expertise.

title: INTENSITY STILL THERE FOR MIDDLECOFF
description: It's been more than 20 years since Cary Middlecoff left the professional golf tour, but the desire that drove him to win two United States Opens, a Masters and 34 other tournaments is still with him, even in low-key husband-and-wife events.

title: Arco Plans Sale
description: The Atlantic Richfield Company said yesterday that it would put four units of its chemical division up for sale to concentrate on the division's principal foam plastic businesses. The Arco Chemical Company's building products, oilfield chemicals, specialty chemicals and precision tool materials units, which accounted for 20 percent of the division's $2 billion in sales last year, would be organized and managed separately. Arco did not break out results for each unit, but said that as a group the businesses were profitable last year.

title: ARUNDEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $491,000 for both the quarter and 6 months. c-Net loss

title: Faint Soviet Signals
description: The mysterious document brought from Moscow by the correspondent of The Guardian of London may be a fake, but it is an interesting comment on the Soviet atmosphere behind the scenes nonetheless.

title: U.S. PLANS TO SPEED DEPORTATION OF DRUG OFFENDERS
description: Immigration officials said today that they would begin holding deportation hearings at New York prisons to speed the expulsion of aliens convicted of narcotics offenses and other crimes.

title: PACT ON SALE OF GENSTAR
description: Cimenteries CBR S.A., a Belgian cement producer, said today that it had agreed to buy the cement operations of the Genstar Corporation from Genstar's parent company, Imasco Ltd. of Canada.

title: NEW HEAD OF EUROPEAN ART AT MET
description: Everett Fahy, director of the Frick Collection since 1973, is to succeed Sir John Pope-Hennessy as head of the European paintings department at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, according to museum officials.

title: MUSIC: BLACK ROCK COALITION
description: THE Black Rock Coalition Orchestra put theory into practice Tuesday night at Sounds of Brazil, with uneven but promising results. The Coalition intends to be ''a forum for alternative writers and musicians,'' one member said onstage. It also seeks to challenge current music-business categories, in which ''rock'' is generally treated as a style played by and for whites, while black musicians are expected to play dance-funk or romantic ballads.

title: GUIDELINES ON CONSTRUCTION
description: BUILDING an in-ground swimming pool can test the patience of the calmest person. Myriad details must be sorted through even after the design has been agreed upon. Safety measures, both during and after construction, unanticipated costs, accessories and maintenance are just some of the issues facing the intrepid pool-owner.

title: Rise of 5.5% Seen In Media Costs
description: Media cost increases of only 5.5 percent next year are the forecast from the 16th annual Media Costs Forecast Survey being published in the August issue of Marketing & Media Decisions, out tomorrow.

title: If Newtown Creek Should Catch Fire Again
description: To the Editor:

title: General Dynamics Sets Debentures
description: The General Dynamics Corporation is offering $74.5 million of 5 3/4 percent exchangeable subordinated debentures due in 2011 at a price of par, through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company. The debentures are rated A-3 by Moody's and A+ by S.&P.

title: The Football Jury's Mixed Signals
description: Whether or not it was a mistake, as one juror suggests, the verdict in the pro football antitrust case was inspired. In finding that the National Football League was guilty of violating antitrust law, the jury put the crusty barons who run the league on notice that they are vulnerable to a serious challenge. But by awarding only a dollar for damages the jurors issued a well-deserved rebuke to the United States Football League for a cynical use of the legal system.

title: REMOVING WAX FROM FURNITURE
description: It is often easy to spot old pine furniture that has been given a wax finish. Such pieces, usually imported, are most often painted and then given a change of face by being stripped and waxed. Their surfaces are often spotted with a whitish filler where countersunk nails have been covered over.

title: Westinghouse Set To Buy More Stock
description: Continuing a restructuring program begun last August, the Westinghouse Electric Corporation said yesterday that it would buy back 10 million, or 6.6 percent, of its shares in the open market or through private purchases.

title: Ex-Moscow Broadcaster Is Sentenced for Spying
description: A former Soviet television commentator has been sentenced to 15 years in prison for spying for West Germany, the official trade union daily Trud reported today.

title: SUNWEST FINANCIAL SERVICES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
BIRD INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $246,000 for both the quarter and 6 months. c-Net loss

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I think that the Chief Justice can exercise a certain amount of leadership on the Court but I don't think it's apt to be in a philosophical direction.'' - Associate Justice William H. Rehnquist. [ A14:1. ]

title: TASTY BAKING CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 28
LYPHOMED INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The year-ago share earnings have been adjusted for 3-for-2 stock splits paid June 20 and Nov. 1, 1985.

title: No Hazard Reported From Iowa Train Wreck
description: Crews today salvaged cookies, skis, chemicals and other goods dumped in a river when the middle 16 cars of a freight train were blown off a bridge in a storm.

title: MUSIC: DAVID HIGGS ON ORGAN
description: DAVID HIGGS, the associate organist of Riverside Church, will soon leave to direct the music of St. Mark's Episcopal Church in Berkeley, Calif. Here's hoping that Riverside brings him back often as a guest to play recitals like the superb one he gave there Tuesday evening.

title: SPECTRA-PHYSICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes an extraordinary credit of $1,500,000 for both quarter and 9 months; 9-month figure is a net loss.

description: b-Reflects a $9 million pretax restructuring charge and a $5 million pretax inventory adjustment, and the after tax impact of these was about $11.6 million.

description: Fifteen-year-old Bathandwa wrote:

title: Alcoa Divisions
description: The Aluminum Corporation of America announced a corporate realignment, setting up five major divisions ''to move closer to principal markets, to focus on profitable business opportunities and to further implement strategy for long-term growth.'' Charles W. Parry, chairman, said the new divisions were: Alcoa Packaging Systems Group, Alcoa Aerospace and Industrial Products Group, Alcoa Metals and Chemicals Group, Alcoa Materials Science Group and Alcoa International Group.

title: BEVERLY INVESTMENT PROPERTIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The 1985 results were not available because the company wasn't in operation prior to its initial public offering in December 1985.

title: OFFICIALS JOIN KOCH TO PRESS NEW ATTACK ON DRUG ABUSE
description: City, state and Federal law-enforcement officials joined with Mayor Koch yesterday to demand a new attack on drug abuse from every level of government. Using strong language, they called for more state judges, more Federal judges, more prosecutors, more courtroom space and the deportation of all illegal aliens convicted of narcotics offenses.

title: JERRICO INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The share earnings reflect 4-for-3 stock split paid in March.

title: VIRGINIA E. POMERANZ
description: Dr. Virginia E. Pomeranz, a New York pediatrician and author, died of cancer Monday at Mount Sinai Medical Center. She was 61 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: GENERAL PUBLIC UTILITIES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
OSHKOSH TRUCK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Revenue figures represent net shipments.

title: The Heat In the Jury Room
description: Margaret Lilienfeld, in conversation yesterday, was recalling the end of the 31 hours over five days that she and the five other jurors spent in the jury room coming to a decision in the antitrust suit brought by the United States Football League against the National Football League.

title: Fair Taxes For All Borrowers
description: It's virtually certain that the Senate-House conference committee on tax reform will allow taxpayers to claim deductions not only for interest they pay on mortgages for their principal residence but also for the interest they pay on a second home. At the same time, there is a very real danger that the committee, should it choose to follow the Senate conferees' recommendations, will deny deductions for ''consumer interest,'' that is, interest not incurred in connection with a taxpayer's business or investments. This is very different from current law, which allows interest deductions on virtually all indebtedness, including the purchase of a car or a loan for a child's education.

title: John Dalton, 55, Dies; Ex-Virginia Governor
description: Former Gov. John N. Dalton, a popular conservative Republican who led the Virginia Republican Party to dominance in the 1970's, died of lung cancer today at the Medical College of Virginia. He was 55 years old.

title: A RESTAURANT FANTASY ON POTOMAC...AND A GALA BENEFIT FOR 600 TO OPEN IT
description: Warner LeRoy's opulent opening party tonight seemed a logical extension of the restaurateur's ''bigger is better'' approach to life. Mr. LeRoy's latest enterprise, Potomac, which seats 1,000 and cost $10 million, was pronounced ''incredible'' by Julia M. Walsh, an investment banker and former president of the Greater Washington Board of Trade.

title: M.T.A. REPORTS BUS MECHANICS OFTEN ARE IDLE
description: The Transit Authority's bus mechanics average an hour and a quarter of idle time a day because of poor supervision, according to a study released yesterday.

title: OAK HILL SPORTSWEAR reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss

title: People Express to Cut Service to Five Cities
description: People Express said today that it would eliminate service to five cities, change its ticket-pricing structure, lease eight of its aircraft to another airline and transfer service to three cities to its Provincetown-Boston Airline subsidiary.

title: A WATER UTILITY PAID $120,000 TO MANES AIDE
description: Richard L. Rubin, who was a top political aide to the late Donald R. Manes, was paid a $120,000 consulting fee to lobby Mr. Manes and others last year on behalf of a private water company in Queens, Mr. Rubin's attorney said yesterday.

title: Bell Atlantic Workers Authorized a Strike
description: Employees of Bell Atlantic, the parent of most local telephone companies in the Middle Altantic states, have voted to authorize a strike if their contract demands are not met, a union official said today.

title: WORLDS OF WONDER reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company did not report sales for the year-ago quarter because it was a development stage company.

title: NEWHALL RESOURCES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Playing in Image Of Flo Hyman
description: Keba Phipps doesn't mind being compared to the late Flo Hyman, but the 17-year-old volleyball phenom says that comparisons are bit early. ''Flo was my idol,'' said the 6-foot-3- inch high-school senior, who is in Houston making her debut in the Olympic Sports Festival competition. She met Miss Hyman during the 1984 Olympics as she was serving as a floorwiper for the volleyball matches. ''Flo was truly a great player, and I just hope I'll be able to play as greatly as she did. We play different positions, but it makes me happy to be compared with her.''

title: Swiss Told to Consider Halting Nuclear Power
description: The Swiss President said today that Switzerland should consider abandoning nuclear power and seeking alternative sources of energy.

title: FOR ABC, NBC'S SUCCESS IS A MODEL
description: Brandon Stoddard, the man Capital Cities has charged with repairing ABC's defeated program lineup, is saying nice things these days about his rivals at NBC, the network whose success is largely responsible for ABC's current low circumstances. NBC, Mr. Stoddard allows, ''deserves credit for finding the road'' to a new era of better television.

title: Misfortune
description: Harvey Myerson, the attorney for the United States Football League in its antitrust suit against the National Football League, thought he had received a favorable omen Tuesday afternoon as he was eating lunch at a restaurant in Chinatown.

title: CAR BOMB KILLS CABINET MINISTER IN A 'HOMELAND' IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: A Cabinet minister in the most troubled of South Africa's so-called homelands died in a car-bomb attack, the authorities reported today, and in other incidents assailants attacked a police station, killing seven people.

title: CLEMENS IS EJECTED IN LOSS TO CHICAGO
description: Greg Kosc, the first-base umpire, ruled that Roger Clemens, Boston's leading pitcher, failed to touch first base with two outs in the fifth inning tonight. The play enabled John Cangelosi to score the go-ahead run from third as the Chicago White Sox beat the Red Sox, 7-2.

title: TM COMMUNICATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
RETHINKING SWIMMING POOLS
description: ALMOST ALL residential swimming pools used to be rectangular turquoise tubs, routinely installed in exact alignment with houses and property-line borders.

title: GEORGIA FARM FAMILY ASKS, 'WHAT ARE WE DOING THIS FOR?'
description: One day last winter when Kathy Wren saw old Thomas McBride, the patriarch of the family that owns the local cotton gin and seed store here, it was one of her bleak days. ''I told him, 'Mr. Tom, it just looks like everything's against us,' '' she recalled.

title: OGILVY GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Revenue figures represent commission and fee income.

title: KILLEARN PROPERTIES INC reports earnings for Year to April 30
3 Unpublished Songs By Copland Discovered
description: Three unpublished songs written by the composer Aaron Copland when he was 17 years old have been discovered in a collection of uncatalogued manuscripts at the University of Texas music library, the university said today.

description: b-After a charge of $1,103,000 net of income taxes and minority interest to reflect the cumulative effect on prior years of a change in accounting principle. c-Includes realized gains on sales of marketable securities, net of tax and minority interest amounted to $2 million. d-Net income The company said the fiscal 1985 results included realized gains on sales of marketable securities, net of tax and minority interest, of $8.6 million, or 52 cents a share, while 1986 had only $100,000, or 1 cent a share, of such income. Share earnings and shares outstanding are adjusted to reflect aggregate stock dividends paid through July 28, 1986.

title: New District Boundaries Approved in Los Angeles
description: Despite protests from Korean residents, the City Council gave final approval today to a redistricting plan that opponents said strengthens some ethnic groups politically at the expense of others.

description: Forty-two years and two months late, the United States Postal Service is trying to return or deliver 253 V-Mail letters from World War II servicemen to their families and sweethearts.

title: Publishing Post Filled
description: Charles E. Hayward has been named the publisher of Simon & Schuster's trade-books division effective Sept. 2. Mr. Hayward was the president of H P Books, the book-publishing subsidiary of Knight-Ridder Newspapers, and before that was the director of sales and marketing at the Macmillan Publishing Company and St. Martin's Press. He replaces David Cully, who resigned after two and a half years at Simon & Schuster.

description: The United States and the Soviet Union made no progress on salvaging or replacing the unratified 1979 treaty limiting strategic arms during a week of talks in Geneva that ended today, Administration officials said.

BRINGING BAMBOO TO URBAN BACKYARDS
description: FEW summer sights are more dramatic, and none are more unexpected, than a stand of bamboo in a New York City garden. Although this plant is alluring, its lovely segmented canes and lush grasslike foliage rarely grace urban backyards or rooftops. But this may change. During the past several years, bamboo species hardy enough to withstand cold winters have become readily available to gardeners. A number of these, and some older varieties, are well-suited to the rigors of city life.

description: * Amoco Oil Co., Chicago, said it had agreed to sell its service station properties in Rhode Island and Massachusetts to Mobil Oil Corp. Terms were not disclosed.

title: Pessimism on Sutter
description: Bruce Sutter, the Braves' reliever who has been on the disabled list since May 28 because of problems with his right shoulder, will probably not pitch again this season, according to Manager Chuck Tanner.

title: BUSH IS IN JORDAN ON A PEACE EFFORT
description: Vice President Bush arrived here from Jerusalem today carrying a private message from the Israelis for King Hussein that is said to offer new suggestions on Middle East peace, but is not expected to bring about a breakthrough.

title: Group Urges India To Block Pepsico
description: Soft drink makers in India urged the Government not to allow Pepsico Inc. to sell its beverages in the country, asserting that Pepsico would destroy the domestic industry and leave a million people jobless.

title: THEATER: LAILA ROBINS IN WILLIAMS 'SUMMER'
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., July 30 - Though less often seen on the stage than either Amanda Wingfield or Blanche DuBois, Alma Winemiller is one of Tennessee Williams's most deeply moving heroines, a woman who is possessed by that classic Williams conflict between the soulful and the sensual. Aptly described as ''a flame, mistaken for ice,'' in the course of ''Summer and Smoke,'' Alma takes a step toward becoming Blanche.

title: BOLIVIAN ASKS U.S. FOR BIG LOAN TO MAKE UP LOST COCAIN INCOME
description: The Bolivian Ambassador to the United States told members of a Senate subcommittee today that his country would need an immediate $100 million loan to help defray the loss of income in Bolivia because of reduced cocaine exports.

title: Comings and Goings
description: Carl Lewis, the first athlete since Jesse Owens to win four Olympic gold medals in track and field, has his eyes on loftier goals. ''I want to go back and win more - I want to be the first to win three gold medals in back-to-back Olympics,'' said Lewis, who is hampered by an injury to his left knee and is limiting his competition in the Olympic Sports Festival in Houston to the long jump and the relay. . . . Lindsey Nelson, the voice of the Mets for 17 years and a broadcaster for the San Francisco Giants for three seasons, has been elected to the American Sportscasters Hall of Fame. He will be inducted Nov. 18 in New York.

title: HOME IMPROVEMENT
description: Q. We have tried various methods to solve our problem - a damp basement - including applying a waterproof coating to the inside walls, making sure gutters empty onto splash pans around the outside of the house, even installing dry wells to handle the runoff. But these have only partly cured the problem, and after every very wet spell, we still get water in the basement. Is there any foolproof method that will solve this problem once and for all? A. The problem is apparently being caused by excess water in the ground around your basement walls. The best way to solve it is to have a good waterproofing contractor excavate around the outside walls. He can then install a waterproof membrane on the outside of the exposed masonry, after which he will lay drain tiles - lengths of perforated plastic pipe - along the footing so the pipes slope downward to a low point.

title: O'BRIEN ATTEMPTING TO REDUCE SACKS
description: When last seen on a football field, Ken O'Brien had just released a pass and then been slammed to the ground by Andre Tippett of the Patriots so severely that the Jet quarterback suffered a concussion and failed to finish the game.

title: DIVERS REPORT NO HULL GASH IN THE TITANIC

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE ALPHABET EFFECT: The Impact of the Phonetic Alphabet on the Development of Western Civilization. By Robert K. Logan. 272 pages. Morrow. $16.95. IT is Robert K. Logan's not entirely original theory that ''of all mankind's inventions, with the possible exception of language itself, nothing has proved more useful or led to more innovations than the alphabet.'' Not only has it ''contributed to the development of codified law, monotheism, abstract science, deductive logic, and individualism, each a unique contribution of Western thought,'' the alphabet ''has also served as a model for classification.'' More significantly still, ''it has provided us with a conceptual framework for analysis and has restructured our perceptions of reality.'' As Mr. Logan concludes: ''These effects take place independent of what we read. The information that is coded is not important; it is the act of coding itself that has been so influential and acted as a springboard for new ideas.'' In other words, the medium of the alphabet has been the message.

title: 'ZORBA'S' LESSONS FOR ANTHONY QUINN
description: Anthony Quinn, who made a lusty mark on the world as that bold, sinewy Greek known as Zorba more than 20 years ago, is about to pluck the last red carnation from behind his ear. For the moment, anyway. Mr. Quinn first played Zorba in the 1964 film version of the Nikos Kazantzakis novel ''Zorba the Greek.'' For the last four years he has toured the country in the musical version, written by Joseph Stein, John Kander and Fred Ebb. The actor will give his final performance in the role at the Westbury Music Fair in Westbury, L.I., on Sunday.

title: QUEENS COMPANY INDICTED ON MINORITY CONTRACT DEAL
description: A Queens construction company with millions of dollars in city contracts and two of its employees were indicted yesterday on charges that they used a bogus subcontracting company and falsified records to evade state regulations on the hiring of companies owned by minorities or women.

title: American Can Net Rises 4.1%
description: The American Can Company, a diversified financial and industrial concern, said yesterday that net income in the second quarter of 1986 increased 4.1 percent on a 5.9 increase in revenues. The company, based in

title: Wilbert Gore, Inventor Of Waterproof Fabric
description: Wilbert L. Gore, founder of the company that manufactures the waterproof fabric Gore-Tex, died apparently of a heart attack Saturday while backpacking. He was 74 years old. Mr. Gore, an avid backpacker and skier, died while hiking in the Wind River Range in Wyoming.

title: WHY CAN'T JOHNNY PLAY THE PIANO?
description: TWO chance impressions have lodged themselves in this critic's mind over the last month, and reawakened a worry. One was a secondhand remark, attributed to a thoughtful and astute member of the music-publishing community, to the effect that the future of music publishing would be very little involved with the production of printed music (promotion, multimedia products, coordination of public events and the like will be the focus instead). The other was a news item about a Connecticut town that could not field enough local players to form a marching band for July 4, and so paraded with hand-held radios tuned to march music.

title: Manhattan Man Seized in Attacks
description: A 24-year-old Manhattan man was arrested yesterday and charged with 3 sexual assaults and 11 robberies since May 3 in Washington Heights, after he was identified by what the police said was his latest victim.

title: CASTLE & COOKE INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 14
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $1,127,000. The 6 months results for both 1986 and 1985 are pro forma for comparative purposes and are not necessarily indicative of what would have occurred if the July 1985 merger of Castle & Cooke and Flexi-Van Corp. had been consummated at the beginning of the year.

title: MUSIC: STRING QUARTET ARRANGED FOR ORCHESTRA
description: AFTER two decades of Mostly Mozart Festivals, it is scarcely surprising that those responsible for devising the programs should be poking into remote, shadowy corners for something different to perform. Occasionally, their searches turn up something that might better have been left where it was, and the final work in the concerts of Tuesday night and last night fell into that category. It was an arrangement for large orchestra of Beethoven's String Quartet No. 4 in C minor and was made by a man named Heinrich Ludwig von Spengel, probably around 1830.

title: BOOTH INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 28
Contradictions
description: When the Supreme Court recently upheld the right of the states to regulate private sexual conduct, it inflamed people who believe in privacy, gratified people who dislike homosexuals - and gave new force to some striking contradictions in American attitudes. These can be framed as questions: Why is it that the people most outraged when government puts its hand in your pocket for taxes are often the people quickest to applaud when government sticks its nose into your bedroom?

title: African Organization Urged To Move to Isolate Pretoria
description: African leaders urged members of the Organization of African Unity today to isolate South Africa, and called on ''freedom-loving'' countries take action against Western governments that have not imposed economic sanctions against Pretoria.

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: CRUISE SHIP EVACUATED IN BAHAMAS AFTER BLAST
description: An explosion and smoky fire today aboard a cruise ship anchored off a small island in the Bahamas forced 987 passengers to flee in lifeboats to a sandy beach 500 yards away where a calypso band and open bar awaited them.

description: b-Net income

title: Mysteries of Science On Display
description: Jeffrey Mosenkis, a seventh grader from Fair Lawn, N.J., peered into a microscope, squeezed a small rubber bulb to send smoke under the lens and saw tiny points of light bouncing against each other. They were, explained a nearby sign, ''particles a few hundred-thousandths of an inch in diameter being jostled by atoms and molecules ten thousand times smaller.''

title: REAGAN CONSIDERS WIDER DRUG TESTS
description: Announcing that President Reagan was planning to use ''the full power of the Presidency'' to curb the use of narcotics, the White House said today that he was considering widespread drug testing for Government employees.

title: FROM SAINT LAURENT, COUTURE SPORTSWEAR
description: Asked whether he considered his relatively calm, rather stately couture presentation today an expression of his classic side, Yves Saint Laurent demurred. He considers it ''provocative,'' he said.

title: TERMINAL DATA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
PLY-GEM INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding for both periods were restated to reflect 3-for-2 stock split effected March 12, 1986.

title: South Africa Heard From
description: Alert scanners of the news will have noticed of late a spate of discussions of the impact that economic sanctions against South Africa would have on neighboring black countries. The interest in that question stems from the House's approval of a package of sanctions against South Africa and the Senate's consideration of one.

title: Priest Attacked in School
description: The Rev. Eugene Prior, a 61-year-old priest, was beaten and robbed at knifepoint by an intruder early yesterday at a Roman Catholic high school on the East Side. Shortly after the attack, a suspect - Hector Rivera, 30, of the Bronx - was arrested outside the school, Loyola High at 53 East 83d Street. Father Prior was slightly injured but refused medical attention.

title: Delta to Increase Cincinnati Flights
description: Delta Air Lines said it would add 55 flights daily to its schedule from Cincinnati International Airport, making Cincinnati its third major traffic hub.

title: CHESS CHAMPION GAINS ADVANTAGE BY A PAWN
description: Gary Kasparov, the defending world chess champion, outplayed Anatoly Karpov, the challenger, in the crucial middle section of the game today and appeared poised to win the second game of their championship match.

title: BALLPLAYERS WIN DRUG-TEST GRIEVANCE
description: An arbitrator ruled against the major league baseball owners yesterday for including clauses in the contracts of several hundred players that allowed random drug testing without negotiating through the union.

title: KIRBY EXPLORATION CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a $4.7 million writedown on the value of oil and gas properties and a non-cash charge of $3 million on the writedown of certain undeveloped acreage and other assets. c-Net income

title: Teamsters May End Detroit Strike Support
description: Trash haulers may withdraw their support from a city workers' walkout, a teamsters' union official said today.

title: U.S. Home Reports Loss
description: The U.S. Home Corporation, the financially troubled home builder based in Houston, said today that it had a loss of $86.3 million in the second quarter, in contrast to earnings of $652,000, or 2 cents a share, a year ago.

title: Non-Farm Output Gains
description: Non-farm business productivity increased at an annual rate of 1.7 percent in the second quarter, but a slight decline in hours worked indicated that many companies were tightening their belts, the Government said today.

title: Husband and Wife Lead Maxicare Rise
description: Maxicare Health Plans Inc., a big operator of health maintenance organizations, is poised to get even bigger with the proposed acquisition of the Health America Corporation for $400 million. Combined sales will be some $1.6 billion this year - quite a bit for a husband and wife team to manage.

title: G.M. Continues to Build In-House Marketing
description: General Motors, as part of its continuing effort to build its internal marketing capability to oversee some $2 billion in annual advertising and promotion spending, has hired Michael A. Browner from the Texize division of Dow Consumer Products for the new position of director of media operations. He will be working for the G. M. Marketing and Product Planning Staff, reporting to Philip Guarascio, former media director of Benton & Bowles, who came in as executive director of advertising services. Mr. Guarascio has since been involved in a program designed to get his employer the best possible negotiated rates from magazines.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: THURSDAY, JULY 31, 1986
description: International The American trade deficit continued in June at a record-breaking pace of $170 billion a year, the Commerce Department reported. At $14.17 billion, last month's deficit was little changed from May. [ Page A1, Col. 6. ]

Gannett Unit to Move
description: The Gannett Outdoor Group, made up of the Gannett Outdoor Group and the Outdoor Network USA, is worth about $1 million in billings to the Bloom Agency, New York. The client, previously handled by Lois Pitts Gershon Pon/ GGK, is a subsidiary of the Gannett Corporation. The Outdoor Network is a group of independent outdoor plant operators.

title: JWT GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
U.S. TRADE DEFICIT CONTINUES TO SOAR AT A RECORD PACE
description: The nation's trade deficit, the force behind much of the economic pressure being felt worldwide, continued in June at a record-breaking pace of $170 billion a year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: California Certificates For Sewage Facilities
description: Three sanitation districts in Orange County, Calif., offered $117 million in certificates of participation yesterday with yields ranging from 5.75 percent for certificates due in 1988 to 7 percent in 1991, 7.20 percent in 1997 and 7.60 percent in 2001.
